svt_uart_err_check Class Reference

Inheritance diagram for class svt_uart_err_check:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

This class register all the UART protocol checks


Public Member Functions

function void  new ( string err_check_name = "", bit register_default_chks = 1, bit enable_default_chks = 1, string full_name = "default_name" )
function void  register_default_checks ( bit enable_checks = 1 )
function void  report_failures ( bit [SVT_UART_MAX_RULE:0] rule )

Member Function Documentation

  function void
 svt_uart_err_check::new
 (  string err_check_name = "", bit register_default_chks = 1, bit enable_default_chks = 1, string full_name = "default_name"  ) 

CONSTRUCTOR: Create a new svt_uart_err_check instance.

err_check_name - A string that identifies this particular svt_err_check instance.

register_default_chks - A bit that identifies whether or not the default checks associated with this sampling/checking class should be registered automatically.

enable_default_chks - A bit that identifies whether or not the default checks associated with this sampling/checking class should be enabled. This bit only has meaning if register_default_checks is set to 1.

  function void
 svt_uart_err_check::register_default_checks
 (  bit enable_checks = 1  ) 

This method is called by the constructor if the register_default_checks parameter is set to 1.

enable_checks - A bit that identifies whether or not the checks that are registered by this function should be enabled or disabled.

  function void
 svt_uart_err_check::report_failures
 (  bit [SVT_UART_MAX_RULE:0] rule  ) 

Member Attribute Documentation

 svt_err_check_stats  attribute
 svt_uart_err_check::svt_err_chk_brk_det_d

Check : This error message is triggered when BREAK (all zero word) is transmitted in downstream direction

 svt_err_check_stats  attribute
 svt_uart_err_check::svt_err_chk_brk_det_u

Check : This error message is triggered when BREAK (all zero word) is transmitted in upstream direction

 svt_uart_err_check::svt_err_chk_cts_before_dsr

Check : This error message is triggered when CTS is asserted by DCE before RTS is asserted

 svt_uart_err_check::svt_err_chk_cts_before_dtr

Check : This error message is triggered when CTS is asserted by DCE before DTR is detected

 svt_uart_err_check::svt_err_chk_cts_before_rts

 svt_uart_err_check::svt_err_chk_inval_trans_bet_off_on_d

Check : This error message is triggered when DTE transmitts any transaction between the XOFF and XON pattern received in the IN-BAND mode

 svt_err_check_stats  attribute
 svt_uart_err_check::svt_err_rs485_de_deassertion

Check : This error message is triggered when stop bit on sout is recieved and de is deasserted before de-deassertion delay

 svt_err_check_stats  attribute
 svt_uart_err_check::svt_err_rs485_de_re_both_not_high_half_duplex_chk

Check : This error message is triggered when in rs485 half duplex mode de and re goes high at same time

 svt_err_check_stats  attribute
 svt_uart_err_check::svt_err_rs485_de_re_rs485_pin_cannot_be_x_or_z

Check : This error message is triggered when any of the three gpio pins for de, re, rs485 mode is x or z

 svt_err_check_stats  attribute
 svt_uart_err_check::svt_err_rs485_de_to_re_turnaround

Check : This error message is triggered when in half duplex mode de to re tat time is not followed

 svt_err_check_stats  attribute
 svt_uart_err_check::svt_err_rs485_no_derive_sin_if_re_off

Check : This error message is triggered when data on sin is observed when re is deasserted

 svt_uart_err_check::svt_err_rs485_no_derive_sout_if_de_off

 svt_uart_err_check::svt_err_rs485_no_derive_sout_sin_if_de_re_off

Check : This error message is triggered when data on sout or sin is observed when de and re are deasserted

 svt_uart_err_check::svt_err_rs485_no_re_de_if_rs485_pin_off

 svt_uart_err_check::svt_err_rs485_re_to_de_turnaround

 svt_err_check_stats  attribute
 svt_uart_err_check::svt_err_sin_not_idle_whn_cts_high

Check : This error message is triggered when SIN is asserted by DCE when CTS is de-asserted. This rule is only enabled when enable_tx_rx_handshake is set to 1'b1

 svt_err_check_stats  attribute
 svt_uart_err_check::svt_err_sout_not_idle_whn_cts_high

Check : This error message is triggered when SOUT is asserted by DTE when CTS is de-asserted. This rule is only enabled when enable_tx_rx_handshake is set to 1'b1

 svt_err_check_stats  attribute
 svt_uart_err_check::svt_err_xoff_with_inval_parity

Check : This error message is triggered when DCE transmits XOFF pattern with invalid parity in the IN_BAND mode

 svt_err_check_stats  attribute
 svt_uart_err_check::svt_err_xon_with_inval_parity

Check : This error message is triggered when DCE transmits XON pattern with invalid parity in the IN_BAND mode
